So to sum up why I disagree: 1. People like choices, even if they don't understand them 2. People like getting paid more for less effort 3. Bitcoin changes require more effort than starting an altcoin or ICO 4. Even if innovations were compensated, people would start new coins

I grant you that there are some *trying* to innovate. Most I've seen are either bad or useless. "Innovations" that would get paid zero in Bitcoin are getting paid a lot in altcoin markets. Hence, I don't think altcoins would disappear with development rewards.
They're worth more, but the amount of money you can make creating TRON vs creating a feature on Bitcoin is very different. The first is much better ROI and greed goes to better ROI.

Unless the incentives were literally billions of dollars, I don't think this would work. Creating TRON got the creators way more than any reasonable reward a developer would have gotten for any feature in Bitcoin.

As far as I know, there are no gains for transferring between 2 wallets that you own. Only gains if it changes hands or gets traded for other crypto (depending on country).

Yes, I agree it is a taxable event. So my point is to only use crypto that I'm not personally invested in as a currency and to only have that crypto interface with USD so that I don't incur tax. Was just trying to share some accounting insights, maybe I didn't explain it well.

You completely missed my point. If I want to buy something with crypto I can buy LTC with USD and send that (no tax event). If I get paid in LTC n cash out to my bank (no tax event). Since I have no LTC investment I can use it as a currency. Nowhere did I mention BTC to LTC trade

I have 2 capital buckets.. one is long term multi-year crypto investments (the key is buying coins cheap before HODLing) #2 is my trading accounts, which I use to stack up USD. Eventually when I feel prices are cheap enough I will add to bucket #1 with some of my trading profits

Results: Locked in gains from 2017 profits. In 2018 my trading accounts are in profit with zero draw downs and I was able to buy a bunch of shitcoins last week for 80-90% discounts in USD.
